pages.text: Building can be tedious - we've all placed millions of blocks. Luckily there's an easier way. Holding $(l)Sneak + Right-Click$() to place blocks allows you to drag and place multiple at once!$(br2)Furthermore, there are different placement modes, cycled with $(l)$(k:linear.switchmode.desc)$().$(br)Note: this keybind conflicts by default, it is recommended to rebind it

pages.title: Building Modes
pages.text: There are 5 Building Modes as follows.$(br2)$(l)Line:$()$(br)$(l)1 Axis:$() Builds between the two points in a straight line along the longest axis.$(br)$(l)2 Axes:$() Builds a straight line between the two points along the two longest axes$(br)$(l)3 Axes:$() Builds a straight line between the two points using all 3 axes.
$(l)Wall:$()$(br)$(l)2 Axes:$() Builds a flat wall between the two points along the two longest axes$(br)$(l)3 Axes:$() Builds a vertical wall between the two points using all 3 axes.
